Submodules

data.components.audio module

Module for adding and handling the playback of audio from audio files.

class data.components.audio.Audio[source]

Bases: object

Class for creating and managing audio channels and sound objects.

add_audio(audio_dir, tag=None)[source]

Load audio from the given path.

Parameters:

  • audio_dir (str) – Directory of the audio file to add.

  • tag (Optional[str]) – The name of the audio to associate with the sound object. Defaults to None, in which case the filename will be used as the tag.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If there is no audio file at the audio directory provided.

Return type:

None

decrease_volume(decrement=0.1)[source]

Decrease the volume by a specified decrement. Volume can’t decrease below minimum even if attempted.

Parameters:

decrement (float) – The amount to decrease the volume by.

Return type:

None

increase_volume(increment=0.1)[source]

Increase the volume by a specified increment. Volume can’t exceed max even if attempted.

Parameters:

increment (float) – The amount to increase the volume by.

Return type:

None

play_audio(tag=None, loops=0, override=False)[source]

Plays the audio of the tag specified. If tag is unspecified the first audio file added to the sounds dict is played. Audio doesn’t play if there is audio currently playing in the channel unless the parameter override is True.

Parameters:

  • tag (str) – The name of the audio to play. Defaults to None which will use the first audio file added to that channel (this should only be used if there is only one audio file loaded for clarity).

  • loops (int) – Amount of times to loop the audio, -1 loops indefinately.

  • override (bool) – Whether the audio should play even if the channel is busy. The previously playing audio will stop.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If no audio has been added to the channel.

  • ValueError – If the loops argument is smaller than -1.

Return type:

None

set_volume(volume)[source]

Set the volume of the audio.

Parameters:

volume (float) – The volume to set the channel to.

Raises:

ValueError – If the volume is not between 0.0 or 1.0

Return type:

None

stop()[source]

Stop the currently playing audio.

Return type:

None

data.components.colors.shift_rgb(rgb_color, shift_amount)[source]

Shifts the color in the RGB spectrum by the specified amount.

Parameters:

  • rgb_color – A tuple of (R, G, B) values where each is in the range 0-255.

  • shift_amount – The amount to shift the color in the spectrum.

Returns:

A tuple of (R, G, B) representing the shifted color.

data.components.input module

Module for getting and handling all forms of user input. Also allows for custom userevents to be detected.

class data.components.input.InputBinder(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Observer

Class for binding inputs to execute callables via the observer algorithm.

Parameters:

inputs (tuple[Literal['key', 'keydown', 'keyup', 'mouse', 'mousedown', 'mouseup', 'quit'], int]) – A tuple of the type and input that the action should be unregistered from.

Return type:

None

Parameters:

Return type:

None

register(*inputs, action)[source]
Parameters:

  • inputs (tuple[Literal['key', 'keydown', 'keyup', 'mouse', 'mousedown', 'mouseup', 'quit'], int]) – A tuple of the type and input.

  • action (Callable) – The action to call upon the input being detected.

Return type:

None

process_events(events)[source]

Process events from the pygame events list.

Clears keydown and keyup events, iterates through and updates the input lists as necessary.

Parameters:

events (list) – pygame.event.get() should be passed in every game tick.

Return type:

None
